bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval is only run on Windows

long_desc.thetext:
The whole org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval suite is only run on Windows since: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=4ebeb381c4e8c6974f665730420b70c72062bb00
I didn't find an explanation why exactly it failed back in 2003, so I think we should just try to run it on Linux, and if it passes locally, then we can remove the onWin32 condition.

The tests generally run fine on Linux.
When the machine was under heavy load, I sometimes got a failure in a org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval.DebugEvaluationTest#test012(): Looks like snippets are not evaluated in proper order or the variable 'date' doesn't get updated promptly.
Removed the restriction: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=a8c16bcddf8ea1c15574f4c6305041f3a02174d1

(In reply to Markus Keller from comment #1)
> When the machine was under heavy load, I sometimes got a failure in a > org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval.DebugEvaluationTest#test012():
This failure also used to show up on Windows occassionally. Thanks!

DebugEvaluationTest works fine with the source code belonging to I20140120-2000.
Verified for 4.4 M5 using I20140120-2000 build.
